text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*James W, Breedlove to Austin, New Orleans, December 4, 1830. Inclosing copy of a notice published by Mexican minister to United States concerning the law of April 8, 1830. Suggests explanation by Austin, which he will publish in United States press.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Mexican Consulate New Orleans */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="12-04-1830">Dece 4 1830.*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col Stephen F Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir You have herewith a publication made by the *person_mentioned*Mexican Minister*/person_mentioned* at *location_mentioned*Baltimore*/location_mentioned*, which has gone forth in a great many *location_mentioned*papers*/location_mentioned* printed in the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned*, this publication has created a belief in the minds of many *person_mentioned*thousands */person_mentioned*that all*person_mentioned* North Americans*/person_mentioned* are prohibited from going to *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*to Settle, and is calculated to do your *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*verry great injury, I feel verry certain that *person_mentioned*Col Tornel*/person_mentioned* did not mean this prohibition to extend to any *location_mentioned*grants */location_mentioned*which stood on the same grounds yours does, and so I have Explained his meaning to all who have called on me*/p*—
*p*I am under the impression that it would be well for you to publish in the *location_mentioned*Texas Gazette*/location_mentioned* under your Signature as *person_mentioned*Empresario */person_mentioned*a full explanation, send it to me and it shall go into the *location_mentioned*News papers of this Country*/location_mentioned*— Unless the prohibitory Idea is explained it will prevent *person_mentioned*thousands */person_mentioned*from Emigrating this *date_mentioned n="Winter-1830">Winter */date_mentioned*and *date_mentioned n="Spring-1831">Spring */date_mentioned*that have intended doing so until they saw or heard of this publication*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jas W. Breedlove*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p*[Inclosure]*/p*
*p*MEXICAN LEGATION IN THE *location_mentioned*UNITED STATES*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*Having received information that several offers have been made to *person_mentioned*citizens of the *location_mentioned*U. States*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* to colonize the *location_mentioned*lands in the State of Coahuila and Texas*/location_mentioned*, I consider it my duty to caution them by publishing the 11th Art. of the law of the *date_mentioned n="04-06-1830">6th of April of 1830*/date_mentioned*, which is as follows :-—*/p*
*p*"Art. 11. In virtue of the authority which has been reserved by the *person_mentioned*General Congress*/person_mentioned* to itself, by Art. 7th of the law of the *date_mentioned n="08-18-1824">18th of August of 1824*/date_mentioned*, all *person_mentioned*foreigners*/person_mentioned*, whose *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*is bounding on said *location_mentioned*State and Territory of the Federation*/location_mentioned*, shall be prohibited from settling within the said *location_mentioned*State or Territory*/location_mentioned*, in consequence of which all the contracts that have not taken effect, and are opposd to this law, shall be suspended."*/p*
*p*Wherefore, I declare, in the name of the *person_mentioned*Mexican Government*/person_mentioned*, that whatever contract shall have been made in violation of the said law, will be null and void, it being understood that colonization in the *location_mentioned*State of Coahuila and Texas*/location_mentioned*, and the *location_mentioned*territory of New Mexico*/location_mentioned*, by *person_mentioned*citizens of the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*, has been prohibited.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Jose M Tornel*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
